intro_text: Your patrol finds the tracks of a baby centipede nearby.
decline_text: Your patrol ignores the centipede.

success_outcomes.text: After a short search, r_c spots the centipede high up on a wall. r_c charts a likely route up and begins to climb. Barely noticed as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/come/comes} level with the creature, r_c skewers it on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} spear and holds it up triumphantly for the rest of the patrol to see.

r_c points with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} spear at the little creature perched high up on a wall nearby and begins to climb up to it. As soon as r_c comes level with it, however, the centipede darts away, making r_c jump. r_c thinks quick and hurls {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} spear, nearly throwing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss}self off the pole. With satisfaction {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} notes the crunch of metal piercing carapace, and goes to get the prey down.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c tries to impale the centipede with a dramatic leap, only to miss completely and go skidding down the wall. Rolled eyes, laughter and reprimands follow the centipede skittering into the dark.

intro_text: Your patrol comes across a swarm of fluttering batflies.
decline_text: Your patrol ignores the batflies. They're inconvenient to catch and not much food.

success_outcomes.text: r_c snatches a batfly out of the air with a squeak of surprise from both prey and apprentice.
app1 leaps off a pole and claps a batfly between both hands, an easy kill! {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP}{VERB/app1/'re/'s} really getting the hang of hunting!

fail_outcomes.text: The batflies narrowly dodge every attept to grab them, leaving everyone frustrated and embarrassed. The patrol has an easier time gathering blue fruit.

intro_text: Your patrol comes across a swarm of squidcadas dipping for leeches.
decline_text: Your patrol leave the squidcadas to their fishing.

success_outcomes.text: When a bold squidcada flies too close to the patrol, r_c takes the opportunity to show it the pointy end of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} spear. Delicious!
A squidcada hovers around r_c curiously, but while it's distracted, p_l takes it out with a quick strike.

As the scavengers cross the water, a couple of the squidcadas try to tackle them off the bridge. Thinking quick when one of the creatures charges {PRONOUN/s_c/object}, s_c grabs hold of it and runs it through. Everyone gathers around {PRONOUN/s_c/object} in congratulations of the skillful kill.

fail_outcomes.text: Despite the patrol's best efforts, the squidcadas tackle everyone into the water, leaving the scavengers soggy, leech-bitten and miserable.

intro_text: Your patrol spots a popcorn plant high up on a ledge.
decline_text: Deciding it's not worth the dangerous climb, your patrol ignores the plant.

success_outcomes.text: It takes a team effort, but r_c manages to get up on the ledge, pierce the plant and pass the seeds down handful by handful.
In an incredible display of agility, s_c scales the ledge and stabs the plant. The patrol cheers as s_c throws down handfuls of seeds.

fail_outcomes.text: It seems impossible to make it up onto the ledge. The patrol will have to find a different source of food.

intro_text: Your patrol comes across a cluster of blue fruit dangling below a hanging platform.
decline_text: Your patrol ignores the bird.

success_outcomes.text: Your patrol makes it across the gap and passes back the fruit to safety.

r_c rolls {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} shoulders and motions for the others to stand back. Leaping and swinging from ledge to pole in a display of incredible grace, r_c hangs down next to the fruit and tosses them all back to the waiting patrol. Outstanding!

fail_outcomes.text: r_c gets the bright idea to knock the fruit down with a spear - sending them all plummetting far out of reach. r_c is never living this down.

intro_text: Your patrol comes across a lake where jetfish skim across the surface.
decline_text: Your patrol decides it's not worth getting wet when jetfish are so hard to catch.

success_outcomes.text: r_c leaps into the water without hesitation, startling the jetfish into scattering. With some reluctance, the rest of the patrol hop in one by one and try to herd the jetfish into one another. Even the sourest scavengers on the patrol have to admit it was a little fun when they come out with a nice haul.

r_c slips into the water as smoothly as an eel lizard and stalks the slowest of the jetfish from below. Just when the creature is resting for a moment, r_c lunges and grabs hold of it. In a panic it races back and forth across the lake, but r_c wrestles it back to shore, where {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} waiting Troopmates finish it off.

fail_outcomes.text: The jetfish prove much too fast for the scavengers to catch, and they return home with a meagre haul of jellyfish instead.

intro_text: While exploring the underground, your patrol finds some water pipes nurturing a cluster of bubble fruit.
decline_text: Your patrol moves on in search of better food sources.

success_outcomes.text: r_c heads to the water's edge and starts tossing bubble fruit in. Once they've all popped, the patrol fishes them back out and counts the spoils.

r_c heads to the water's edge and starts tossing bubble fruit in. Suddenly an eel lizard erupts from the water and charges {PRONOUN/r_c/object}! Thinking quick, r_c stabs it in the gut, and the rest of the patrol set upon it to finish it off. What a catch!

fail_outcomes.text: r_c heads to the water's edge and starts tossing bubble fruit in. Suddenly an eel lizard erupts from the water and charges {PRONOUN/r_c/object}! Panicking, r_c hits it in the snout with a rock and bolts. The patrol is driven off without any bubble fruit or any lizard meat.

intro_text: Your patrol finds a pond with a school of jellyfish bobbing in it.
decline_text: Your patrol decides not to harvest the jellyfish.

success_outcomes.text: p_l leads a successful fishing session. Almost everyone walks home with an armful of jellyfish.
s_c makes fishing look easy, giving out tips to any interested scavengers.

fail_outcomes.text: A clumsy fishing session leaves everyone running for home sopping wet and covered in stings for to the healer to treat.

intro_text: r_c spots a slugcat up ahead sporting a brilliantly-coloured pelt and a spear with an oddly vibrant tip.
decline_text: Judging the risk of confronting the slugcat to be too great, r_c alerts the rest of the patrol and they make sure to give the slugcat a wide berth.

success_outcomes.text: The confrontation turns violent. Miraculously, no scavengers are injured, but when it comes to the slugcat - well, meat is meat.
The confrontation turns violent, and while no scavengers are injured, the patrol is forced to kill the intruder. Their body is taken back to camp and paid the proper respects.

Reminding the others that slugcats are just as intelligent as scavengers, s_c decides to approach alone. Upon noticing s_c, the slugcat crouches to show they mean no harm. They point the patrol in the direction of a food source and carry on their way.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c throws a spear at the slugcat, but misses. Head snapping around, the slugcat hisses at the patrol and scurries away.

The confrontation turns violent. Though no scavengers are injured, the patrol decides the slugcat's body will do in place of more conventional meat. Later r_c, who brought the body back, and any who eat the meat become violently ill.

history_text.reg_death: This scavenger died after eating meat from a toxic slugcat.
history_text.lead_death: after eating meat from a toxic slugcat

intro_text: A lantern mouse bursts out of a pipe, squeaking in terror, and makes a break for it past the patrol.
decline_text: They watch it go, just as startled.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol rallies almost instantly, and manages to corner and catch the lantern mouse!
s_c reacts quickly, tearing off after the lantern mouse and stabbing a spear through its head to bring it down.

fail_outcomes.text: Your patrol jumps after it, but the lantern mouse has too great of a head start and disappears into a tangle of pipes.

s_c is quicker than anyone else, tearing after the lantern mouse, but in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} haste {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/put/puts} a foot wrong and {VERB/s_c/stop/stops} as a sharp twinge of pain shoots up {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} leg.

intro_text: A spider bursts out from a pipe, startled by r_c.
decline_text: {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/watch/watches} it scuttle up the wall and tuck itself into an unseen den, just as startled.

success_outcomes.text: r_c manages to scale the wall after it and drive a spear through it!
s_c reacts quickly, tearing off after the spider and slamming a paw on its head to bring it down.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c jumps after it, but the spider shoots up the wall too fast.

s_c reacts quickly, tearing after the rabbit, but in {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} haste {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/put/puts} a foot wrong and {VERB/s_c/stop/stops} as a sharp twinge of pain shoots up {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} leg.

intro_text: As the patrol spreads out to hunt, r_c admits {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/think/thinks} {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} had a vision from StarClan last night.
decline_text: The patrol doesn't talk about the vision.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol talks to {PRONOUN/r_c/object} about whether it was a real vision as they hunt.
p_l takes r_c aside, giving {PRONOUN/r_c/object} the full benefits of {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} seniority and experience as they discuss {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} vision.
s_c chooses to hunt with r_c, the spiritual warrior gently guiding the conversation. r_c feels deeply privileged and far more at peace after confiding in {PRONOUN/p_l/object}.

fail_outcomes.text: No one can make sense of the vision.
r_c notices p_l looking at {PRONOUN/r_c/object} enviously, withdraws from the rest of the patrol, and dismisses the dream as unimportant.

intro_text: As {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/head/heads} out to hunt, r_c thinks about the dream {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} had last night... was it sent by StarClan?
decline_text: {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/push/pushes} it from {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mind.

success_outcomes.text: It definitely distracts {PRONOUN/r_c/object} from the hunt, but r_c uses the time by {PRONOUN/r_c/self} to put {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} thoughts in order. It was a sign from {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} ancestors. Now {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/need/needs} to figure out what to do next.

Somehow hunting brings r_c to almost a meditative state, and not only {VERB/r_c/are/is} {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} fairly confident of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} next steps having been given this vision, but {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} also {VERB/r_c/bring/brings} back a good haul to the food store.

s_c often feels like StarClan walks with {PRONOUN/s_c/object}, and this is just another instance on the path. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/use/uses} the solo patrol to collect {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} thoughts, and by the time {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/pad/pads} home with a good catch, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject}{VERB/s_c/'re/'s} ready for the next step {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} vision hinted at.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c can't make sense of the vision.

intro_text: r_c is tempted to eat the food {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} just found.
decline_text: r_c decides against breaking the warrior code.

success_outcomes.text: {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/resist/resists} the temptation, going on to make a couple of great catches to make sure the elders are fed.

After all, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} caught enough on this solo hunt that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} won't be able to carry it all back to camp. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/stop/stops} for a quick snack and {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to camp laden with prey for the fresh-kill pile.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c gives in to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} grumbling belly, reasoning that no one will notice, but when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/arrive/arrives} back at camp empty-pawed and with crumbs in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} chest fur, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/feel/feels} the stares of the other warriors on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} back.

intro_text: r_c is tempted to eat the prey {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} just caught.
decline_text: r_c decides against breaking the warrior code.

success_outcomes.text: {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/resist/resists} the temptation, going on to make a couple of great catches to make sure the elders are fed.

After all, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} caught enough on this solo hunt that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} won't be able to carry it all back to camp. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/stop/stops} for a quick snack and {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to camp laden with prey for the food store.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c gives in to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} grumbling belly, reasoning that no one will notice, but when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/arrive/arrives} back at camp empty-handed and with crumbs in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} chest fur, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/feel/feels} the stares of the warriors on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} back. r_c slinks back to the apprentices' den, head low.

intro_text: r_c is tempted to eat the prey {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} just caught.
decline_text: r_c decides against breaking the warrior code.

success_outcomes.text: {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/resist/resists} the temptation, going on to make a couple of great catches to make sure the elders are fed.

After all, the patrol has caught enough on this hunt that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'ll have trouble carrying it all back to camp. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/stop/stops} for a quick snack and {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to camp laden with food for the stores.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c gives in to {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} grumbling belly, reasoning that no one will notice, but when the patrol reforms and r_c arrives back empty-handed with crumbs in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} chest fur, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/feel/feels} the suspicious stares of the other warriors on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} back.

{PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/think/thinks} {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'ve/'s} gotten away with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} clandestine snacking, but when r_c arrives back at camp, another patrol member pulls the deputy aside for a quiet word, glaring back at r_c. The deputy assigns {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to dig a new trench for the Clan's dirtplace, and r_c hears snide remarks when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/slink/slinks} into {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} nest that night.

intro_text: r_c is tempted to eat the food {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} just found.
decline_text: r_c decides against breaking the warrior code.

success_outcomes.text: {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/eat/eats} the food without anyone noticing.

After all, the patrol has found enough that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}'ll have trouble carrying it all back to camp. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/stop/stops} for a quick snack and {VERB/r_c/return/returns} to camp laden with food for the stores.

fail_outcomes.text: {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/think/thinks} {PRONOUN/r_c/subject}{VERB/r_c/'ve/'s} gotten away with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} clandestine snacking, but when r_c arrives back at camp, another patrol member pulls the deputy aside for a quiet word, glaring back at r_c. The deputy assigns {PRONOUN/r_c/object} to dig a new trench for the Clan's dirtplace; r_c prickles with humiliation and terrible smells.

intro_text: Over the next rise, the patrol hears the gushing of gas and sees vulture wings flailing.
decline_text: p_l makes the decision to look for food elsewhere. Whatever is going on sounds far too dangerous to investigate.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol creeps towards the noise. They arrive just in time to see a vulture flying off, leaving the corpse of another limp and maskless on the ground. Certain members of the patrol are a little disappointed they couldn't claim the glory of the kill for themselves, but this will feed the troop for days!

Scaling the rise, they arrive just in time to see one vulture flying off, leaving the corpse of the other limp and maskless on the ground. When they descend to take their share of meat, they surprise a lizard who had the same idea! There's even more meat to take back to camp.

fail_outcomes.text: Scaling the rise, they arrive just in time to see one vulture flying off, leaving the corpse of the other limp and maskless on the ground. When they descend to take their share of meat, however, a blast of gas sends them scattering as the killer swoops back down. Everyone escapes unscathed, but p_l has to spend the rest of the day gathering the patrol instead of food.

intro_text: The patrol comes across a lantern mouse with a bloated belly and strange discoloured spots fast asleep in a den.
decline_text: Sensing something off, p_l decides to look for other prey, but the patrol meets with no success.

success_outcomes.text: The patrol easily kill the sleeping lantern mouse. It's not the most honourable kill, but it's food.

r_c slips into the den and raises {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} spear to dispatch the creature. It opens its huge eyes, but instead of making a run for it, just squeaks weakly. Something about the situation fills r_c with dread, and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} decides to leave it alone.

s_c slips into the den to dispatch the creature. The rest of the patrol is surprised when s_c returns empty-handed, but s_c explains that the lantern mouse was sick enough to poison anyone who ate from it.

Before anyone makes a move, s_c stops the patrol. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/explain/explains} that rogues and loners are taught at a young age to stay away from lantern mice that look like this one to avoid the deadly sicknesses they carry.

Before anyone makes a move, s_c stops the patrol. {PRONOUN/s_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/s_c/explain/explains} that the lantern mouse's strange appearance points to its infection with a deadly parasite. It's not worth the risk of catching, no matter how hungry the Troop is.

fail_outcomes.text: r_c slips into the den to dispatch the lantern mouse, only to burst back out with fur bristling. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/exclaim/exclaims} that it was already stone dead, and something horrible was crawling out of its mouth!
r_c slips into the den to dispatch the lantern mouse, only for it to suddenly wake up and lunge at r_c. It shoots past r_c and the entire rest of the patrol, disappearing down a pipe.

r_c easily kills the sleeping mouse. It's not the most honourable kill, but food is food. Unfortunately, upon digging into {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} prize back home, r_c rushes to wash the foul taste out of {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mouth. {PRONOUN/r_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/r_c/bury/buries} the parasite-ridden mouse away from camp, but it's too late. Over the next few days r_c falls violently ill and never recovers.

history_text.reg_death: m_c died after eating a parasite-infested lantern mouse.
history_text.lead_death: died after eating a parasite-infested lantern mouse

fail_outcomes.text: r_c easily kills the sleeping mouse. It's not the most honourable kill, but food is food. intro_text: app1 huffs in frustration when all scents of prey are drowned out by slugcat scent. {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/follow/follows} the scent to discover a... creature that {PRONOUN/app1/subject} {VERB/app1/are/is} unable to identify.
decline_text: One can never be too cautious around strange creatures; who knows whether it could be deadly? {PRONOUN/app1/subject/CAP} {VERB/app1/are/is} just an apprentice after all! app1 backs away from the thing, praying that StarClan understands {PRONOUN/app1/poss} empty-handed return.

success_outcomes.text: app1 cautiously greets the creature, who reassures {PRONOUN/app1/object} that it is, in fact, a slugcat in a mask and wrappings. Whew! Now app1 can return to {PRONOUN/app1/poss} hunting in peace, knowing the silly slugcat poses no harm.

Boldly, s_c steps forward to interrogate the thing, who explains that it is a slugcat that must put up with its Iterator friend's insistence on something called "costumes". It even offers to let s_c try its accessory!

fail_outcomes.text: While attempting to stalk the strange creature, app1 trips and falls flat on {PRONOUN/app1/poss} face. The creature startles and flees directly into a pipe. Sullen, app1 trots home empty-pawed and full of questions about what {PRONOUN/app1/subject} even encountered.

intro_text: The patrol splits up to hunt, but after a while r_c is nowhere to be found.
decline_text: p_l heads home without r_c, annoyed that r_c would abandon the patrol.

success_outcomes.text: p_l decides to continue on without r_c and manages to make a few good catches. Although things are going well, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/feel/feels} something watching {PRONOUN/p_l/object}... and getting closer! p_l turns around, ready to strike, only to find r_c sneaking up on {PRONOUN/p_l/object}! The pair of scavengers have a good laugh over the failed prank and carry the food back to camp together.

After making some good catches, p_l picks up on r_c's scent. Feeling mischievous, p_l decides to give r_c a good scar. p_l creeps closer and closer until r_c is in range, but suddenly r_c whips around with eyes wide! Both r_c and p_l jump with fright, spines puffed out! It takes a moment but both scavengers have a good laugh at the scare they gave each other, and promise not to tell anyone about how easily startled they were.

fail_outcomes.text: p_l decides to continue on without r_c and manages to make a few good finds. Although things are going well, {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} {VERB/p_l/feel/feels} something is watching {PRONOUN/p_l/object}... and getting closer! p_l jumps out of {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} skin as something leaps out of the shadows and knocks {PRONOUN/p_l/object} over! p_l hops up, ready to strike, only to come face to face with {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} attacker... r_c, shaking with laughter!

p_l heads off without r_c and manages to make a few good finds, when something nips {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} paw! Unable to catch a scent from whatever it was, p_l assumes it to be some kind of prank and furiously looks for r_c. Upon finding {PRONOUN/r_c/object}, p_l begins to complain but r_c cuts {PRONOUN/p_l/object} off, accusing p_l of nipping {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} instead! Both scavengers fall silent with unease when they realize something else was the culprit, likely watching them both from the shadows... The patrol quickly heads back to camp.

intro_text: As the patrol follows a trail into a darkly shadowed part of the territory, night shadows begin to play with their vision. Was that movement up ahead? r_c spots the undisguisable silhouette of a scavenger ahead. Malicious eyes and bristled fur meet the patrol as they walk amongst the shadows. The stranger's fur is translucent, and it moves as though made from a strange dark mist.
decline_text: r_c's tail bristles with fear, a cold shiver creeping along {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} back. This is definitely not a normal cat, and {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} quickly {VERB/r_c/turn/turns} the patrol back to camp.

success_outcomes.text: Your patrol confronts the strange scavenger - they are obviously an intruder on c_n territory, and they don't look like the friendly type. The dark silhouette seems to flicker in and out of view as the patrol runs toward it, gradually reappearing further and further away. The patrol stops, watching the stranger in the distance. Glowing, haunted eyes watch them back from the shadows. The patrol returns home, mesmerized by the strangeness of what they just witnessed.

fail_outcomes.text: Your patrol confronts the strange scavenger - they are obviously an intruder on c_n territory, and they don't look like the friendly type. The strange scavenger shrieks, an awful, blood-curdling scream that makes r_c's fur stand on end. Overcome by terror, the patrol flees back to camp.
